revision.text:
{{spoiler}} {{Infobox Character |name = K |image = Consul K.png |species = [[Moebius]]
Human (formerly) |age = |gender = Male |haircolor = Gray |eyecolor = Red |affiliation = [[Consul]]s |appearances = {{XC3}} |voiceactorjp = [[wikipedia:Mitsuo Iwata|Mitsuo Iwata]] |voiceactoreng = [https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0583534/?ref_=ttfc_fc_cl_t95 Eric Meyers] }} {{quote|It's the big bad boss. Boo!|K}} '''K''' is a character in {{XC3}}. == Overview == K is the [[Consul]] of Colony 4, Ethel describes his as a "particularly punctual sort of character." == Story == [[File:Consul K Meeting.png|thumb|210px|left|K discussing business with Ethel and Borealis]] K first appears looking at [[D]]'s signal that [[Ouroboros]] has reemerged. He then has the other colonies turn on them like the other [[Consul]]s. K is present at [[Origin]] during an argument between the other Consuls. After [[Z]] interrupts their argument, [[N]] appears from the shadows to ask K if he will go to fight Ouroboros to which he agrees. Arriving at [[Colony 4]], K is greeted by [[Ethel]] and [[Bolearis]] but he is displeased by the dust and [[Weather (XC3)|fog]] surrounding the Colony, mockingly stating that the place befits its Dirt rank status. Inside his quarters, K reveals the reason for his visit to Ethel, requesting that she take care of some ''"vermin"'', a band of deserters from both sides. Ensuring their complete loyalty, K manipulates the Irises of Ethel and her soldiers so that they will see [[Noah]] and his allies as enemies as part of his plan. [[File:Nourish-Moebius.png|thumb|210px|K's Moebius form, consuming energy from Colony 4's Flame Clock]] While passing through the [[Eagus Wilderness]], Noah and his allies are hunted down by Ethel and Colony 4's [[Ferronis]]. The party retreat into an area filled with [[Black Fog]] which affects K's control over Ethel's Iris and allows her to see their true identities. Angered, K teleports in front of the party to fight them himself, deeming Ethel pathetic and striking her with lightning. Though K is easily defeated by the party in his base form, he transforms into his [[Moebius]] form and consumes the life energy from Colony 4's [[Flame Clock]], causing the party to stand down out of fear of hurting their friends. Noah hatches a plan to break the Flame Clock despite the risks but his and Mio's attempt is unsuccessful due to Noah's Blade being unable to cut through the Ferronis. With [[Riku]]'s encouragement, Noah tries again to break the Flame Clock, this time using [[Lucky Seven]] and is successful, much to K's utter surprise and confusion. With the Flame Clock broken, Noah and the party are able to easily defeat K who cries out in fear as he dies. [[File:K Unmasked.png|thumb|210px|left|right|K is unmasked]] After K's defeat, [[Lanz]] decides to remove his mask and the party are surprised to find that his face is old and wrinkled like [[Guernica Vandham]]'s, with [[Eunie]] questioning if this is what aging is like. As Ethel comes to her senses, K's body fades away and Noah, feeling K's essence brush past him, decides to send him off in spite of his evil acts in life, though the others were surprised he'd do that. {{clr}} == Legacy == Because using his own Iris has led him to his own death, the other Consuls comments that K is a "one-trick pony". Furthermore, all of them have abandoned that method of controlling their colonies entirely. Although, [[B]] thought K's plan was sound and would've worked if he hadn't had the bad luck of there being Black Fog in the area. The artist [[Stefaan]] is revealed to have painted a portrait of K prior to his demise, having previously been a fan of the Consul. The Ouroboros take this portrait to the [[City]] to be appraised by [[Wellwell]] to help further Stefaan's artistic ambitions. {{clr}} == Battles ==
|-|Consul K = {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Consul K |image = Consul K.jpg |caption = Consul K |category = Boss |type = [[Consul (enemy)|Consul]] |level = 17 |area = [[Eagus Wilderness]] ([[Colony 4]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = No |movement = Ground |detection = |exp = 504 |cp = 300 |sp = 0 |gold = 0 |hp = 99,000 |strength = 250 |healing = 125 |dexterity = 63 |agility = 41 |physdef = 30% |ethdef = -10% |critrate = 0% |guardrate = 0% }} |-|Moebius K = {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Moebius K |image = Moebius K.jpg |caption = Moebius K |category = Boss |type = [[Moebius]] |level = 17 |area = [[Eagus Wilderness]] ([[Colony 4]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = No |movement = Ground |detection = |exp = 672 |cp = 400 |sp = 0 |gold = 0 |hp = 216,000 |strength = 314 |healing = 125 |dexterity = 63 |agility = 41 |physdef = 30% |ethdef = -10% |critrate = 0% |guardrate-front = 15% |guardrate-side = 15% |guardrate-back = 0% }}
'''Consul K''' is a [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] who is a [[Consul (enemy)|Consul]] and is fought at level 17 at [[Colony 4]] in [[Eagus Wilderness]]. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 50% |topple = 0% |daze = 0% |burst = 0% |launch = 0% |smash = 0% |blowdown = 90% |knockback = 90% |physdebuff = 25% |etherdebuff = 30% }} '''Moebius K''' is a Boss who is a [[Moebius]] and is fought at level 17 at [[Colony 4]] in [[Eagus Wilderness]]. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 50% |topple = 0% |daze = 0% |burst = 0% |launch = 0% |smash = 0% |blowdown = Immune |knockback = Immune |physdebuff = 65% |etherdebuff = 30% }} {{clr}} === Challenge Battle Mode === {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Moebius K |image = XC3 Moebius K DLC Battle.jpg |caption = Moebius K |category = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |type = [[Moebius]] |level = 73 |area = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |spawntime = During ''[[Stage of Destiny]]'' |respawn = No |movement = Ground |detection = |exp = 5,824 |cp = 400 |sp = 0 |gold = 0 |hp = 1,188,280 |strength = 1,337 |healing = 458 |dexterity = 241 |agility = 146 |physdef = 30% |ethdef = -10% |critrate = 0% |guardrate-front = 15% |guardrate-side = 15% |guardrate-back = 0% }} '''Moebius K''' is fought at level 73 during the second wave of the [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge Battle]] ''[[Stage of Destiny]]''. {{clr}} == Trivia == * Given K's elderly appearance when unmasked, it is likely that he was a member of the [[Lost Numbers]] prior to becoming a Consul, rather than a [[Keves]]i or [[Agnus|Agnian]] soldier. {{clr}} == Gallery == === Artwork === Consuls K and X.jpg|Consul and Moebius K concept art === Screenshots === K Homecoming.jpg|K fading {{XC3CharNav}} {{xc3 stub}} {{for|the enemy in {{XC2|-}}|Kallas Skwaror (XC2)}} {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Kallas Skwaror |image = Kallas Skwaror (XC3).jpg |caption = Kallas Skwaror |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Skwaror]] |level = 21-22 |area = [[Ribbi Flats]] ([[Sparres Barr]])
[[Dannagh Desert (XC3)|Dannagh Desert]] ([[Great Idalla Ravine]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = Ground |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = }} '''Kallas Skwarors''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. They are members of the [[Skwaror]] family, and can be found at level 21-22 at [[Sparres Barr]] in the [[Ribbi Flats]] and near [[Great Idalla Ravine]] in the [[Dannagh Desert (XC3)|Dannagh Desert]]. == Drops == * [[Powdered Skwaror Leaves]] * [[Round Skwaror Crystal]] {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:Fornis Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Skwarors]] [[Category:XC3 Level 21-25 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:XC3FR Minor Enemies]] [[Category:Aurora Shelf Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Skwarors]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing drops]]

'''Kananuses''' are a family of enemies in {{XC3}}. They are beast like creatures found in [[Origin]], resembling [[Volff]]s.
== Normal Minor Enemies == *[[Eruno Kananus]]
== Unique Monsters == *[[Thaumawolf Bajeek]] {{clr}} == Gallery == <gallery> XC3 Thaumawolf Bajeek.png|Thaumawolf Bajeek </gallery>

[[file:Ruchik Kapiba.png|thumb|Ruchik Kapiba]] '''Kapibas''' are small enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They look like the large rodent [[wikipedia:Capybara|Capybaras]], and come in yellow and white varieties. The latter are only found in the [[Kingdom of Tantal]] in {{XC2}}.

=== Unique Monster === * [[Craven Piggard]]

revision.comment: poison breath goes first in the "three breaths" combo
revision.text:
{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Kilocorn Grandeps |image = XC3 Kilocorn Grandeps.png |caption = Kilocorn Grandeps |type = [[Ardun]] |level = 95 |area = [[Rae-Bel Tableland]] ([[Dumas' Jaw]]) |category = [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] ([[Superboss]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = Ground |detection = |exp = 8,104 |cp = 296 |sp = 25 |gold = 2,940 |hp = 7,288,750 |strength = 2,652 |healing = 587 |dexterity = 327 |agility = 166 |physdef = 70% |ethdef = -35% |critrate = 20% |guardrate-front = 30% |guardrate-side = 20% |guardrate-back = 20% }} '''Kilocorn Grandeps''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|千古角のグランデプス}}, ''Senkokaku no Gurandepusu'', lit. Millenary Horned Grandeps) is a [[Superboss]] in {{XC3}}. It is a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] and a member of the [[Ardun]] family and can be initially found at level 95 at [[Dumas' Jaw]] in [[Rae-Bel Tableland]]. The [[Soulhacker#Enemy Skills|Monarch's Heart]] [[Skill (XC3)|Skill]] can be earned by the [[Soulhacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] by defeating it. Through re-challenging, Kilocorn Grandeps' level can be increased to a maximum at level 150. == Battle == ===Skills=== Kilocorn Grandeps has several innate skills: *Shortens duration of debuffs on self by 50%. *Boosts damage from Toxin by 200%. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 100% |physdebuff = Immune |etherdebuff = 80% |knockback = Immune |blowdown = Immune }} {{clr}} ===Enraged=== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:70%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 80% HP. |- !Effects |style="text-align:left;"|Boosts damage dealt by 25%.
Regenerates 0.2% of HP every 3.0s.
Negates enemy guard; inflicts [[Break (XC3)|Break]] if guard is attempted. |} ===Arts=== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:150%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes !Use Conditions |- |'''''Auto-Attack''''' |Physical |One Target |1 |220% | | |Anytime |- |rowspan="3"| '''Horn Dance''' |rowspan="3"| Physical |rowspan="3"| AOE around User |rowspan="3"| 4 |rowspan="2"| 130% | [[Knockback (XC3)|Knockback]] on first hit only |rowspan="2"| |Anytime at or below Lv 125 |- | Knockback on all hits | Anytime during Lv 130-145 fights; at Lv 150, used only when above 60% HP |- |250% |[[Break (XC3)|Break]] > [[Topple (XC3)|Topple]] > [[Launch (XC3)|Launch]] > [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] from first through fourth hits. Each stage of the combo requires the corresponding earlier stage to be inflicted. |style="text-align:left"| *Accuracy is boosted by 25%. *Art is telegraphed with a 10.0s timer. |When reduced to 60% HP during Lv 150 fight |- |rowspan="2"| '''Tank March''' |rowspan="2"| Physical |rowspan="2"| Frontward AOE |rowspan="2"| 3 |rowspan="2"| 155% |Knockback on first two hits, Blowdown on third hit |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 25%. |When reduced to 80% HP during fights at or below Lv 125; anytime during Lv 130-140 fights |- |Knockback on first two hits, Topple on third hit |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 25%. *Topple duration is extended by 50%. |Anytime during Lv 150 fight |- |rowspan="2"| '''Breath''' |rowspan="2"| Ether |rowspan="2"| Frontward AOE |rowspan="2"| 1 |rowspan="2"| 90% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. |Anytime during fights at or below Lv 105 |- | [[Evasion Down]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. *Removes all buffs from target upon landing a hit. *At Lv 150, when reduced to 40% HP, the Art is telegraphed by a 3.0s timer, but followed up by Poison Breath and then Ice Breath in quick succession. |Anytime during fights at Lv 110 or above |- |rowspan="2"| '''Ice Breath''' |rowspan="2"| Ether |rowspan="2"| Frontward AOE |rowspan="2"| 1 |rowspan="2"| 125% |rowspan="2"| [[Freeze]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 10%. |When reduced to 60% HP during Lv 95 fight; anytime during Lv 100-115 fights |- |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 10%. *Removes all buffs from target upon landing a hit. |Anytime during fights at Lv 120 or above |- |rowspan="2"| '''Poison Breath''' |rowspan="2"| Ether |rowspan="2"| Frontward AOE |rowspan="2"| 1 |rowspan="2"| 135% | [[Toxin]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 10%. | When reduced to 40% HP during Lv 95 fights, or to 60% HP during Lv 100-115 fights |- | Toxin / [[Resistance Down]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 10%. *Removes all buffs from target upon landing a hit. | When reduced to 60% HP during Lv 120-125 fights, or to 80% HP during Lv 130-150 fights |- |rowspan="2"| '''Killer Dunk''' |rowspan="2"| Physical |rowspan="2"| AOE around User |rowspan="2"| 1 |rowspan="2"| 180% |rowspan="2"| Knockback |style="text-align:left;"| *Art is telegraphed by a 4.0s timer. | When reduced to 40% HP during Lv 95 and Lv 110-125 fights, or to 60% HP during Lv 100-105 fights |- |style="text-align:left;"| *Art is telegraphed by a 2.0s timer. | When reduced to 80% HP during fights at or above Lv 130 |} === Superboss Challenges === After defeating it for the first time, Kilocorn Grandeps can be re-fought at increasing levels by selecting the "Challenge" option on its [[Named Grave]]. After defeating it at a given challenge level, it will appear at the next challenge level the next time it is challenged, until reaching its maximum level. Thus, only the initial Lv 95 version and the final Lv 150 challenge version can be refought. Kilocorn Grandeps has the following stats changed from its base Lv 95 version in each challenge version. Physical and Ether Defense, Critical Rate, Guard Rates and resistances are unchanged in these challenge versions. SP is not dropped from defeating it in a challenge, since the challenge counts as a refight. Lv 100=

Lv 100
